result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy Oscar Danielson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superAgency.name: District Attorney
superAgency.notes:
For the period of this agreement, the def will comply with the following conditions:  

1.  Def shall notify Atty Dan Johns of any change of address or phone number within five (5) days of such change.  2.  Def shall have monthly contact with Atty Dan Johns via phone or letter.  3.  Def shall pay the sum of $65/month to Atty Dan Johns for monitoring this agreement.  4.  Def shall make payment arrangements with the IC Clerk of Court regarding any fines, court costs, surcharges, and/or atty fees due the Court.  5.  Def has paid restitution in the amount of $1044.51 in case 16CF44 plus the 10% surcharge fo $104.45 to the Iron County DA's Office and $30.00 in case 16CM24 plus the 10% surcharge of $3.00 , total restitution paid is $1181.96.  6.  Def shall have not negative contact with law enforcement.  Def's bond conditions will not continue.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy Oscar Danielson

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jeremy Oscar Danielson
Current: 503 Harju Street, Wakefield, MI 49968 United States  (Effective: 02-08-2019)
Prior: 503 Harju St., Wakefield, MI 49968 United States

Defendant Jeremy Oscar Danielson in court with attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls 18CF18, 16CF44 and 18TR174 at 2:34 p.m.  Cites appearances.   Def counsel states agreement.  DA agrees with def counsel recitation of agreement.  Court questions def re agreement.   Court dismisses Count #1 in 18CF18.  Per DA, vic rights have been complied with.  As to Counts #2 and #3, def pleads guilty.  No coercion, PLQ filed.  Court questions def further.  Finds def freely, knowingly and intelligently pleads.  Factual basis for plea.  In 18TR174, Def pleads guilty.  Court finds BAC to be .08 and imposes as follows:  $628.80 fine/AODA, 6 month revocation.  Court orders in 18CF18:  Sentence withheld, 2 years Probation with 6 months ICJ as condition, Huber, Good Time, CTS.  Def shall also participate in treatment per DOC instruction, pay $1186.96 remaining restitution in 16CF44.  DNA sample and surcharge.  Def shall also pay costs on one count.  60 days to report to ICJ.  Concurrent sentence on Counts #2 and #3.  Adj.  klr
Sentencing hearing on October 8, 2018 at 02:30 pm.
Review hearing on September 5, 2018 at 10:00 am.
to Enter Judgment

Attorney Latzig will be here in p.m.  To continue until 2:00.  Defendant advised to come back at 1:00 as some cases are off calendar.  klr 

Back on record in p.m.  DA calls 16CM24 and 16CF44.  16CM24 was set for PTC, 16CF44 was set for init.  In 16CF44, attorney Latzig acknowledges receipt of complaint.  Waives the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Requests a STC.  Defendant agrees.  Court grants waiver of time limits.  Bond continues.  klr

Jeremy Danielson in court, in custody.  Frederick j Schellgell appears on behalf of the State of Wisconsin.  Cites appearances.  Possible charges are misd. theft, entry to dwelling, felony bail jumping.  Public def info given.  $500 cash/no contact with N. family.  Right to counsel explained by Judge.  Court questions def re ability to raise money.  Court sets $500 cash bond with condition of no contact with N. family.  To be set once counsel is available.  This is an omnibus bond.  Any other conditions on this case as well.  klr
This is an omnibus bond.  Defendant is to stay out of Dan R.'s place of business (victim in 16CM24) and to have no contact with Niemi family in pending case.
